result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Nmi Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolutely no contact with the vicitm or her family.

Pay DOC Supervision Fees. 

Register as a Lifetime Sex Offender

Sex Offender Assessment and comply with recommendations. 

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations as deemed appropriate by the PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations. 

Court costs remitted due to length of sentence.

No restitution requested.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
NAME OF PARTY NEEDING INTERPRETER:  Defendant
NAME OF INTERPRETER: Tou Yang
AGENCY:  SWITS
LANGUAGE:  Hmong
ON-SITE OR TELEPHONE:  telephone
START TIME:  10:24 am 
STOP TIME: 10:34 am

10:24 am - Attorney Meredith Davis in court for Defendant Richard Nmi Vang. Prosecuting Atty Emily Hynek appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard Nmi Vang appeared by phone means. Tou Yang - interpreter by phone
Court reads conclusion of competency evaluation - not competent at this time but will likely have competency restored
Hynek - State agrees with Dr's findings. 
Davis - We discussed the Dr's report and agree. 
CT:  Not sure if out-patient restoration program will take him based upon residency. 
Davis - Program will not take him.  He will be going to a hospital.  That has not been set up.   My understanding is once he is committed, the Dept will let him know when a bed is available and his family will get him there. 
CT:  Def is committed to State Dept of Health Services will notify counsel and family once bed is available.  Family will provide transportation.  Status report will be required before next hearing.  Davis will prepare Order.  Def will need to cooperate. 
Rev: to be set in 60 days after admission.

Prepared by Christina M.H. Engen, WFU
Per TWB:  copy to counsel - Hrg set?
For Competency Exam by DHS

from Atty Meredity Davis  re: At the last Calendar Call parties discussed Comp Evaluation.  CRT instructed the Defense to decide by next Hrg, originally set for 3-16-16, whether we would like evaluation.  At this time we are requesting evaluation be done - order is attached
